Event.name: Coincidence
Event.definition:
<def-root>A State_of_affairs (a state or event) either holds or occurs, and is presented as being causally independent of other (implicit) states or events that might otherwise have been expected to be causally related to the State_of_affairs. The Time or Place may also be mentioned.
<ex><fex name="State_of_affairs">That they got the same answers</fex> is just a <t>coincidence</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: State_of_affairs
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> (that is, an event or state) that holds independently of (potentially) causally-related States of affairs.
<ex>Is it a <t>coincidence</t> <fex name="soa">that most of the planets fall within the Titius-Bode law's boundaries</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
<ex><fex name="tim">Last night's</fex> <t>coincidences</t> were too much for me to handle.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
<ex>Several strange <t>coincidences</t> <fex name="pla">at the airport</fex> got the attention of federal officials.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the target word not covered by a more specific FE.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: coincidence.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a remarkable concurrence of events or circumstances without apparent causal connection.

lexUnit.name: accident.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: something that happens by chance or without apparent cause.

lexUnit.name: chance.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: (esp. with "by" or "due to") a random event.

lexUnit.name: chance.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: occur without any particular expectation.
